application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description: Front Garden - Front Boundary Left Hand SideT1 - PinePrune back from roof area to allow 1.5-1.8 metres clearance, remove as much Ivy as possible, Remove major dead and diseased wood. Fell as close to ground level as possible 2x Self Set Holms at base..	The tree is located in the front garden to the left hand side.	Reduction back from the building to reduce the extent of the encroachment to the front elevation and roof area.	Felling of the understory self set Holm Oaks as the trees have no long term future in their location due to the dominant Pine TreeT2 - YewReduce height by approximately 2.5 - 3 metres to area of compact growth, Reduce extended limbs overhanging public footpath by approximately 1.5 metres to balance, sever Ivy..	The tree is located in the front garden to the left hand side.	Reduction in height and width to reduce the tree to a suitable size for its location.	To balance the crown due to the neighbouring property cutting the tree back from their driveway.	To reduce the extent of the encroachment from the adjacent pine treeFront Garden - Right Hand SideT3 - PrunusReduce length of all branches by up to 1.8-2 metre ensuring natural shape and balance typical of species is maintained where possible.Remove as much Ivy as possible..	The tree is located in the front garden to the right hand side.	Reduction is part of a maintenance program to maintain the tree at a suitable size for its location.	To reduce the encroachment from the building.	To allow suitable light levels in to the front garden and the front elevation of the buildingFront Garden - Front Boundary Right Hand SideT4 - LimeRemove basal and epicormic growth upto and around Crwon break, lift to 4 metres..	The tree is located in the front garden to the right hand side of the front boundary.	Lifting of the lower crown and removal of basal and epicormic growth to reduce the encroachment from the highway and front garden area.	To allow more suitable light levels throu...
